title: Showing that RIOT does listen to us.
body:
For all those people who say "There is no point posting your opinions because RIOT never listens" 
this is a post i made a while ago:
http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/n8qToFGN-azir-weird-mechanic-for-chasing-with-multiple-soldiers
explaining an issue i had with Azir and how the soldiers moved when there were multiple ones on the field.
maybe someone saw it, maybe its just a coincidence but the solution i mentioned has found its way onto the PBE
as stated:
"Conquering sands: In the event of 3 or more soldiers; the closest soldier to the target location will now always be the 2nd/Middle soldier in the 1-2-3 format. This is changed from being ordered by age."

it might make it into the patch or it might not, either way it has at least been considered and given a test run.
RIOT may not have even seen my post, it might have been someone on another server who got noticed or someone in RIOT who had the same thought,
either way it shows that the game isn't 100% perfect and even though we might think our opinions are insignificant, it might be the simplest thing that someone has overlooked, but if you don't say anything then how can it change.
anyway I'm glad that this has been considered and hope it makes its way into the next patch.
thanks RIOT :)

replies.body:
Riot does listen, to the extent that even player creations can make their way into the game (e.g. Void Fizz). I think they could listen a bit more in OCE, but I suppose if you really think something needs rectifying you can post about it on the NA forums. Even if they weren't listening to you specifically though, I am sure that they are listening to the group of people bothered by Azir mechanics.
Also, WishfulJellyfish - why so rude?

Yes i saw void fizz before and after it became part of the game, and was really impressed with the riot.
i just wanted to let people know that riot does so much for us and they do definitely take note of what we say.
